snippet: The locations, known as Collyers’ mansions after the two brothers who died in their overstuffed home in 1947, present such dangers to firefighters that the Fire Department tries to keep track of them.
abstract: Fire Department of New York is so aware of the dangers of battling blazes in homes of hoarders, posed by blocked entryways and piles of debris, it keeps track of what it calls Collyers' Mansions, after two brothers who died in their overstuffed home in 1947; while location where Lt Gordon Matthew Ambelas died was not identified as such, high-rise apartment in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, was cluttered and officials are still investigating the circumstances of the firefighter's death.
lead_paragraph: The locations, known as Collyers’ mansions after the two brothers who died in their overstuffed home in 1947, present such dangers to firefighters that the Fire Department tries to keep track of them.

headline.main: Firefighters Have Name for Deathtrap Homes
headline.print_headline: Firefighters Have Name for Deathtrap Homes
